events.message: Applicant submitted the loan application online for a personal loan to cover upcoming medical expenses and related costs.
The application was reviewed and categorised correctly under personal loans given the stated purpose of medical expense coverage.
A loan officer was promptly assigned to help guide the applicant through the personal loan application process.
The loan officer performed an initial review, confirming the completeness of the application and identifying additional information needed.
Additional documentation was requested from the applicant, including recent medical bills and proof of income to verify financial status.
Applicant submitted all requested documents on time, including detailed medical expense statements and employment verification.
A credit check was completed, returning an average credit score consistent with the applicant’s financial history.
The risk assessment was completed by the underwriting team, noting moderate risk but acceptable within the lending criteria.
An offer was presented to the applicant with loan terms including interest rate, repayment schedule, and total loan amount details.
The applicant responded positively to the loan offer and requested clarification on specific repayment dates.
The application was escalated to senior management to address the applicant’s feedback and finalize repayment terms.
Senior management approved the loan after reviewing the escalated concerns and confirming all conditions were met.
Funds were disbursed to the applicant’s bank account, enabling timely coverage of the medical expenses as planned.
A follow-up was conducted to ensure the applicant understood repayment terms and to answer any further questions.
The loan application case was closed successfully after confirming all formalities were completed and the applicant was satisfied.
